_guide.title: Knowledge Graph Usage Guide
_guide.description: Comprehensive guide for navigating and utilizing the TuneTON knowledge graph

sections.title: Knowledge Graph Structure
content: The knowledge graph is organized into hierarchical nodes, each representing a major system component.
Each node contains detailed information about a specific aspect of the TuneTON ecosystem.
Nodes are interconnected through relationships that define how components interact.

nodes.name: knowledge_graph
nodes.purpose: Root node containing the entire system architecture

nodes.name: node_tuneTON
nodes.purpose: Core application logic and business rules

nodes.name: node_telegram_api
nodes.purpose: Telegram Web App API integration and features

nodes.name: node_ton_blockchain
nodes.purpose: TON Blockchain integration and smart contracts

sections.title: How to Use the Knowledge Graph
instructions: 1. To understand a component, find its node using the line markers above.
2. Each node contains 'entities' (components) and 'relations' (how they connect).
3. Use 'features' to understand capabilities of each component.

sections.title: Best Practices
tips: Always check relationships to understand component dependencies.
Use line numbers (LXXX) to quickly navigate between related components.
Update the graph when making architectural changes.
Reference the official documentation links for implementation details.

knowledge_graph.description: Structured knowledge graph for TuneTON application and TON Blockchain ecosystem

entities.name: TuneTON Application
entities.description: Music streaming and NFT marketplace application on TON Blockchain

entities.name: Wallet Integration
entities.description: TON wallet connectivity and transaction management

entities.name: TON Virtual Machine
entities.description: Execution environment for TON smart contracts

entities.name: Supabase Backend
entities.description: Open source Firebase alternative providing database, authentication, and real-time capabilities

entities.name: TON Storage
entities.description: Decentralized file storage system on TON

entities.name: TON Proxy
entities.description: Decentralized proxy and content delivery network

entities.name: TON DNS
entities.description: Decentralized naming system for human-readable addresses

entities.name: TON Connect
entities.description: Protocol for connecting TON wallets to dApps

entities.name: TuneTON Marketplace
entities.description: Marketplace for music NFTs and digital assets

entities.name: Supabase
entities.description: Open source Firebase alternative for backend services

relations.description: TuneTON is built on TON Blockchain
Application includes music player functionality
Application includes NFT marketplace functionality
Application includes wallet integration
TON Blockchain includes TVM for smart contract execution
TON Blockchain supports smart contracts
Wallet integration connects to TON Blockchain
NFT Marketplace uses smart contracts for NFT management
TuneTON Application uses Supabase for backend services
Music Player uses Supabase for audio metadata and user preferences
NFT Marketplace uses Supabase for product listings and transactions
Wallet Integration uses Supabase for transaction history and user wallet data
TuneTON uses TON Storage for decentralized file storage
TuneTON uses TON Proxy for decentralized content delivery
TuneTON uses TON DNS for human-readable addresses
TuneTON uses TON Connect for wallet integration
TuneTON includes the TuneTON Player for music playback
TuneTON includes the TuneTON Marketplace for NFT trading
TuneTON Player uses TON Storage for music file storage
TuneTON Marketplace uses TON Storage for NFT metadata and assets
TuneTON Marketplace uses TON Connect for wallet transactions
TuneTON uses Supabase for backend services and database
TuneTON Player uses Supabase for user data and preferences
TuneTON Marketplace uses Supabase for marketplace data and transactions
Supabase integrates with TON Blockchain for blockchain data indexing

component_reference.title: TuneTON Application Component Reference
component_reference.description: Key components in the TuneTON application and their relationships

important_relations.purpose: Leverages Telegram WebApp for authentication and UI components
Manages NFT minting and trading functionality
Sends playback updates to the Now Playing bar
Manages user authentication during onboarding
Adds AI-powered features to the music playback experience

components.purpose: Updated version with enhanced features and React/TypeScript implementation

components.purpose: Horizontal swipe navigation between pages

components.purpose: Enhanced music player with effects and queue management

components.purpose: NFT minting and trading functionality

components.purpose: Handles Telegram WebApp authentication

components.purpose: Multi-step user onboarding process

components.purpose: Core audio playback functionality

components.name: useTelegramAuth
components.purpose: Manages Telegram authentication state

entities.name: TuneTON_New
observations: Updated version of TuneTON with enhanced features

entities.name: SwipeNavigation
observations: Implements horizontal swipe navigation between pages
Includes visual indicators for current position

entities.name: MusicPlayback_New
observations: Integrates with MusicPlayer and MusicPlayerNew components

entities.name: NFTMarketplace_New
observations: Allows minting and trading music NFTs

entities.name: OnboardingFlow
observations: Includes welcome screens, genre selection, and artist preferences
Uses React state management for step progression

entities.name: AudioPlayer
observations: Handles play/pause, seek, and volume controls
Integrates with audio worklets for visualization

entities.name: NowPlayingBar
observations: Provides quick access to player controls

entities.name: SpectrumVisualizer
observations: Uses Web Audio API for analysis

entities.name: TelegramWebApp
observations: Provides UI components matching Telegram's design

entities.name: TuneTON
observations: A music streaming and NFT marketplace application
Built with React, TypeScript, and Vite

entities.name: Frontend
observations: Uses Vite for development and building
Implements responsive design with Tailwind CSS

entities.name: Backend
observations: Uses Supabase for authentication and database

entities.name: Authentication System
observations: Uses JWT tokens for API authentication

entities.name: NFT Marketplace
observations: Allows users to buy and sell music NFTs
Primary user interface built with React and TypeScript
Handles user authentication and session management
Handles TON wallet connection and authentication
Manages Telegram authentication state and user data
Provides database, authentication, and serverless functions
Uses Supabase Auth for user management
RESTful API calls for data exchange
Connects to TON wallet for blockchain operations
Handles NFT minting, buying, and selling on TON
Uses utilities from telegramAuth for low-level operations
Implements Telegram Web Login for user authentication
Integrates Telegram Payments for in-app purchases
Publishes to Mini App Store for user discovery
Web Login enables secure payment processing
Mini App Store requires Telegram Payments for monetization

Shows the initialization flow of the Web App
Demonstrates how theming enhances UI features
Shows how device capabilities extend Web App functionality
Shows how viewport management affects the Web App UI

node_telegram_api.description: Comprehensive documentation for Telegram Web Apps (Mini Apps) integration, including Mini Apps Store features and seamless Telegram integration

discovery.store_featuring: Chance to be featured in Telegram's Mini App Store

monetization.in_app_purchases: Support for digital goods and services

engagement.native_sharing: Direct sharing to chats and stories

authentication.bot_linking: Connect website accounts with Telegram bots

setup_steps: Choose a bot with matching name and profile picture
Configure widget using Telegram's tool and embed on site
security_notes: Bot must be configured with domain for security
User data is verified via Telegram's servers

implementation_notes: Uses login_url parameter in inline buttons

entities.name: TelegramWebLogin
observations: Provides secure authentication for external websites
Supports both widget and inline login methods
Verifies user data via Telegram's servers
Can request write access to user's account

entities.name: TelegramPayments
observations: Supports Telegram Stars for digital goods

entities.name: MiniAppStore
observations: Featured apps reach 500M+ monthly active users

entities.name: TelegramMiniApps
observations: Official documentation for Telegram Mini Apps (Web Apps)
Provides JavaScript API for creating interactive interfaces within Telegram

entities.name: MiniAppLaunchMethods
observations: Seven launch methods: profile button, keyboard button, inline button, bot menu button, inline mode, direct link, attachment menu
Keyboard Button: Can send data back to bot using Telegram.WebApp.sendData
Inline Button: Receives basic user info and can send messages on behalf of user
Menu Button: Customizable button for quick access to Mini App

entities.name: WebAppInitialization
observations: Provides access to theme settings, viewport info, and device features

entities.name: ThemeIntegration
observations: Automatic theme matching with Telegram app

entities.name: UIFeatures
observations: Viewport management with stable height calculation
Safe area insets for device-specific UI elements

entities.name: DeviceIntegration
observations: Access to device features: camera, location, storage

entities.name: TelegramWebApp
observations: Main entry point for Telegram Web Apps
Provides access to all Web App functionality

entities.name: initData
observations: Includes user, chat, and auth_date information

entities.name: themeParams
observations: Provides access to Telegram theme colors
Updates in real-time when theme changes

entities.name: expand
observations: Expands the Web App to full viewport
Returns a Promise that resolves when animation completes

entities.name: onEvent
observations: Handles theme changes, viewport changes, etc.

entities.name: MainButton
observations: Shows action button at the bottom

entities.name: CloudStorage
observations: Methods: setItem, getItem, getItems, removeItem, getKeys

entities.name: WebAppInitData
observations: Contains initialization data for the Web App
Includes user, chat, and auth information
Contains query_id for sending messages back to bot

entities.name: Viewport
observations: Provides viewport height and stable height
Supports CSS variables for responsive design

entities.name: HapticFeedback
observations: Impact styles: light, medium, heavy, rigid, soft

entities.name: BiometricManager
observations: Supports fingerprint, face ID, and other biometric methods

entities.name: DeviceIntegration
observations: Access to device sensors and features

entities.name: SafeAreaInset
observations: Provides safe area insets for device UI elements
Includes top, bottom, left, and right insets

entities.name: ContentSafeAreaInset
observations: Defines safe area for content within Web App
Takes into account system UI elements
Helps prevent content from being hidden by notches or UI controls

entities.name: ViewportEvents
observations: safeAreaChanged: Fired when safe area insets change
contentSafeAreaChanged: Fired when content safe area changes
viewportChanged: Fired when viewport dimensions change
themeChanged: Fired when device theme changes

entities.name: ThemeParams
observations: Provides access to user's theme settings
Includes colors for different UI elements
Updates in real-time when theme changes
Includes bg-color, text-color, hint-color, link-color, button-color, etc.

entities.name: StoryShareParams
observations: Used with the native story editor
Can include custom text and URLs

entities.name: WebAppInitData
observations: Contains data received from Telegram during Web App initialization
Includes user, chat, and authentication information
Should be validated on the server side

entities.name: WebAppUser
observations: Contains user ID, first name, last name, username
May include profile photo URL and language code

entities.name: WebAppChat
observations: Contains chat ID, title, and type (group/channel)
May include photo URL and username
Available in WebAppInitData when launched from a chat

entities.name: DataValidation
observations: Validates data received via the Mini App
Verifies initData signature on the server side
Prevents data tampering and replay attacks
Should be performed for all sensitive operations

entities.name: ThirdPartyValidation
observations: Essential for OAuth and API integrations

entities.name: MiniAppEvents
observations: qrTextReceived: When QR code is scanned
clipboardTextReceived: When text is received from clipboard
writeAccessRequested: When write access is requested

entities.name: AttachmentMenu
observations: Allows bots to add custom buttons to the attachment menu
Appears in the attachment menu when sending messages
Can be configured with different button types and icons

entities.name: UserAgentData
observations: Provides additional data in User-Agent header
Includes platform, app version, and device info
Useful for analytics and feature detection
Available in all web requests from the Mini App

entities.name: StoryWidgetLink
observations: Defines a widget link for stories
Can include custom text and URLs

entities.name: ScanQrPopupParams
observations: Configures the native QR code scanner popup
Can include custom text and button labels

entities.name: PopupParams
observations: Supports title, message, and multiple buttons
Can be used for alerts, confirmations, and inputs

entities.name: PopupButton
observations: Defines a button in a native popup
Can have text and a callback function
Can close the popup when clicked

entities.name: EmojiStatusParams
observations: Allows setting custom emoji status with duration

entities.name: DownloadFileParams
observations: Requires proper CORS headers on server
Supports custom filename and MIME type
Requires Content-Disposition header for cross-platform support

entities.name: SafeAreaInset
observations: Provides safe area insets for device UI elements
Includes top, bottom, left, and right insets
Updates dynamically when device orientation changes
Helps prevent content from being hidden by notches or UI controls
Represents the physical safe area of the device

entities.name: ContentSafeAreaInset
observations: Defines safe area for content within Web App
Takes into account Telegram UI elements (header, bottom navigation)
Updates when Telegram UI elements are shown/hidden
Helps position content within the visible area of the Web App

entities.name: CloudStorage
observations: Persistent key-value storage for Web Apps
Stores up to 1024 items per user
Methods: setItem, getItem, getItems, removeItem, getKeys

entities.name: BiometricManager
observations: Manages biometric authentication on the device
Supports fingerprint, face ID, and other biometric methods

entities.name: BiometricRequestAccessParams
observations: Configures the biometric access request popup
Can include custom title and message

entities.name: BiometricAuthenticateParams
observations: Can include custom title and message
Defines authentication behavior and fallback options

entities.name: Accelerometer
observations: Provides access to device accelerometer data
Emits 'accelerometerChanged' event with x, y, z coordinates

entities.name: AccelerometerStartParams
observations: Can set update interval in milliseconds
Defines coordinate system and reference frame

entities.name: DeviceOrientation
observations: Provides access to device orientation data
Emits 'deviceOrientationChanged' event with alpha, beta, gamma angles

entities.name: DeviceOrientationStartParams
observations: Can set update interval in milliseconds
Defines reference frame and coordinate system

entities.name: Gyroscope
observations: Provides access to device gyroscope data
Emits 'gyroscopeChanged' event with x, y, z rotation rates

entities.name: GyroscopeStartParams
observations: Can set update interval in milliseconds
Defines coordinate system and reference frame

entities.name: LocationManager
observations: Provides access to current location and updates

entities.name: LocationData
observations: May include altitude, speed, and heading
Timestamp indicates when the location was determined

entities.name: DeviceStorage
observations: Provides access to device's local storage
Persists data even after app restart

entities.name: SecureStorage
observations: Provides secure storage for sensitive data

entities.name: Fees
observations: TON blockchain charges fees for computation, storage, and message forwarding
Fees are paid in TON cryptocurrency (nanoTON precision)
Smart contracts need to maintain a balance to cover fees
Three main fee types: Storage, Computation, and Forward fees

entities.name: Storage_Fee
observations: Cost of storing contract data on-chain
Considers bits and cells used by contract data
Deduplicates identical cells to optimize storage

entities.name: Computation_Fee
observations: Cost of executing smart contract code
Calculated based on gas used during execution
Should be tested with worst-case scenarios

entities.name: Forward_Fee
observations: Can be estimated using SENDMSG with +1024 mode

entities.name: Critical_Vulnerabilities
observations: Missing impure modifier on critical functions

entities.name: Secure_Programming_Patterns
observations: Always use impure modifier for state-changing functions
Use ~ for modifying methods that should update state
Validate all integer operations for overflow/underflow

entities.name: Smart_Contracts
observations: Can process internal/external messages and get methods
Get methods allow reading contract state without fees
State includes: balance, code, data, and status (Nonexist/Uninit/Active/Frozen)
Development uses Blueprint for project scaffolding

entities.name: Message_Processing
observations: Uses actor model for message passing
Internal messages: from other contracts, can carry value
External messages: from outside blockchain, no value transfer
Message body typically includes opcode for operation type
Uses message flags for controlling behavior

entities.name: Internal_Messages
observations: Can be bounced back if unhandled

entities.name: External_Messages
observations: Used for contract initialization and privileged operations
Should be used with caution due to security implications

entities.name: Contract_Storage
observations: Uses Cell as fundamental data structure
Cells can store up to 1023 bits (128 bytes)
Cells can reference up to 4 child cells

entities.name: Get_Methods
observations: Allow reading contract state without fees
Can be called without creating a transaction
Return values are serialized using Cell format
Commonly used for data retrieval in wallets and explorers

entities.name: TON_DApps
observations: Comprehensive guide for developing DApps on TON
Covers wallet integration and smart contract interaction

entities.name: TON_Connect
observations: Supports multiple wallets and authentication methods
Enables transaction signing and message sending

entities.name: Critical_Vulnerabilities
observations: Missing impure modifier on critical functions

entities.name: Secure_Programming_Patterns
observations: Always use impure modifier for state-changing functions
Use ~ for modifying methods that should update state
Validate all integer operations for overflow/underflow

random_number_generation.description: Techniques for generating secure random numbers in TON smart contracts
recommendations: Avoid using plain random() function for critical operations
Use block random seed with additional entropy
Consider using external oracles for critical randomness

common_vulnerabilities.description: Frequently encountered security issues in TON smart contracts

best_practices: Conduct thorough testing and security audits
Follow the principle of least privilege

best_practices: Implement proper error handling and validation
Optimize gas usage in contract methods
Follow security best practices for smart contract development

component_reference.title: Supabase Backend Component Reference
component_reference.description: Key components in TuneTON's Supabase backend and their line numbers for quick reference

important_relations.purpose: Primary data storage with Row Level Security
Handles user authentication and sessions
Manages file storage for media and uploads
Powers live updates and real-time features
Serverless functions for custom business logic

components.name: PostgreSQL_Database
components.purpose: Relational database with tables for users, tracks, playlists, and transactions

components.name: Authentication_Service
components.purpose: Manages user authentication with Telegram and TON Connect integration

components.name: Storage_Service
components.purpose: Handles file storage for audio tracks, covers, and user avatars

components.name: Realtime_API
components.purpose: Enables live updates and real-time features across the application

components.name: Edge_Functions
components.purpose: Custom serverless functions for specific business logic and API endpoints

description.overview: Supabase serves as the primary backend service for TuneTON, providing database, authentication, and real-time capabilities.
key_features: PostgreSQL database with Row Level Security
Storage for user uploads and media
integrations: Telegram Web App for user sessions
TON Blockchain for on-chain data verification

rls_policies: Users can only read/write their own profile
Public read access to tracks and playlists

edge_functions.description: Handle TON payments and NFT minting

edge_functions.name: sync-ton-data
edge_functions.description: Synchronize on-chain data with the database

edge_functions.name: generate-streaming-url
edge_functions.description: Generate secure streaming URLs for audio files
